docs.lead_paragraph: Today, we’re tracking the bill that would require employers to make “reasonable accommodations” for workers who become pregnant.
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column laments that Pregnancy Workers Fairness Act, bill that would require employers to make 'reasonable accommodations' for workers who become pregnant, has failed to gain traction in Congress except among some Democrats; observes that bill has popular support, but almost no one does anything about it because there is little to gain politically or financially by siding with working mothers.
docs.snippet: Today, we’re tracking the bill that would require employers to make “reasonable accommodations” for workers who become pregnant.

docs.lead_paragraph: The death of an endangered Puget Sound orca found on Vancouver Island in Canada might have been related to pregnancy issues, a research group said Friday.

headline.main: Endangered Puget Sound Killer Whale Found Dead
headline.print_headline: Endangered Puget Sound Killer Whale Found Dead

docs.snippet: The death of an endangered Puget Sound orca found on Vancouver Island in Canada might have been related to pregnancy issues, a research group said Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A village on a remote Alaska island in the Bering Sea has been without a regular mail delivery service since the community's only postal worker quit last month because of pregnancy.

headline.main: Regular Mail Becomes Less So in Alaska Village
headline.print_headline: Regular Mail Becomes Less So in Alaska Village

docs.snippet: A village on a remote Alaska island in the Bering Sea has been without a regular mail delivery service since the community's only postal worker quit last month because of pregnancy.

docs.abstract: Jackie Calmes described her reporting and her effort to put together her story about activists who help women travel to faraway clinics.
docs.snippet: Jackie Calmes described her reporting and her effort to put together her story about activists who help women travel to faraway clinics.

docs.lead_paragraph: Police say a New York doctor choked a woman inside a home and forced her to swallow a pill that could cause an abortion after she told him she was pregnant.

headline.main: Cops: NY Man Forced Woman to Swallow Abortion Pill
headline.print_headline: Cops: NY Man Forced Woman to Swallow Abortion Pill

docs.snippet: Police say a New York doctor choked a woman inside a home and forced her to swallow a pill that could cause an abortion after she told him she was pregnant.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials, using data from birth certificates, said there were 3.93 million births in 2013, down slightly from 3.95 million in 2012.

headline.main: U.S. Birthrate Declines for Sixth Consecutive Year; Economy Could Be Factor
headline.print_headline: U.S. Birthrate Declines for Sixth Consecutive Year; Economy Could Be Factor

docs.abstract: National Center for Health Statistics reports there were 3.93 million births in United States in 2013, down slightly from 3.95 million in 2012; rate declines for sixth consecutive year, with sluggish economy being possible factor.
docs.snippet: Officials, using data from birth certificates, said there were 3.93 million births in 2013, down slightly from 3.95 million in 2012.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Oregon woman is suing her former high-tech employer for more than $400,000, contending she was fired while pregnant with her second child after being told she took too many restroom breaks.

headline.main: Lawsuit: Pregnant Woman Fired for Restroom Breaks
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit: Pregnant Woman Fired for Restroom Breaks

docs.snippet: An Oregon woman is suing her former high-tech employer for more than $400,000, contending she was fired while pregnant with her second child after being told she took too many restroom breaks.

headline.main: Facts & Figures: America’s Unique Take on Maternity Leave

docs.abstract: In the U.S., paid parental leave is more of a perk than a guarantee.
docs.snippet: In the U.S., paid parental leave is more of a perk than a guarantee.

docs.lead_paragraph: Spending $25 per woman per year on full sexual health services would dramatically reduce mother and baby deaths and give women the choice of smaller, healthier and more productive families, a UN-backed report found on Thursday.

headline.main: Sexual Health Report Says $25 Per Woman Per Year Would Reduce Deaths
headline.print_headline: Sexual Health Report Says $25 Per Woman Per Year Would Reduce Deaths

docs.snippet: Spending $25 per woman per year on full sexual health services would dramatically reduce mother and baby deaths and give women the choice of smaller, healthier and more productive families, a UN-backed report found on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Court of Appeal on Thursday rejected claims that a child born with severe brain damage because her mother drank excessively while pregnant was a victim of crime, a ruling which has important consequences for expectant women.

headline.main: Child Disabled by Mother's Drinking Not Crime Victim: UK Court
headline.print_headline: Child Disabled by Mother's Drinking Not Crime Victim: UK Court

docs.snippet: Britain's Court of Appeal on Thursday rejected claims that a child born with severe brain damage because her mother drank excessively while pregnant was a victim of crime, a ruling which has important consequences for expectant women.
